abstract: Authorities on Friday accused two computer programmers for their role in helping the convicted money manager Bernard L. Madoff cover up the Ponzi scheme at Bernard L. Madoff Investment Securities for more than 15 years.
snippet: Authorities on Friday accused two computer programmers for their role in helping the convicted money manager Bernard L. Madoff cover up the Ponzi scheme at Bernard L. Madoff Investment Securities for more than 15 years.
lead_paragraph: Update | 1:51 p.m. The New York Times’s Diana B. Henriques has more details here.

headline.main: 2 Programmers Are Charged With Aiding Madoff
